import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'; import { useParams } from "react-router-dom"; export const DetailProduct = () => { const { id } = useParams(); // Get the product ID from the URL params console.log(id, 'id'); // You can keep this for debugging const [product, setProduct] = useState({}); // State to store product details const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); // State to handle loading state const [error, setError] = useState(null); // State to handle errors useEffect(() => { const fetchProduct = async () => { try { const response = await fetch(`https://fakestoreapi.com/products/${id}`); if (!response.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch product'); const data = await response.json(); setProduct(data); // Set the product data in state setLoading(false); // Stop loading } catch (error) { setError(error.message); // Set error message if fetching fails setLoading(false); // Stop loading } }; fetchProduct(); }, [id]); // Add 'id' to the dependency array, so it refetches when the ID changes // Show loading spinner if data is still loading if (loading) return
Loading...
; // Show error message if there's an error if (error) return
Error: {error}
; return (
{/* Placeholder for image slider, adjust URLs accordingly */}

{product?.title}

(18 reviews)
${product?.price}

{product?.description}

); };
